sense.name: Drop steeply
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[patient] DIVE (ADVP) NP1[patient] DIVE (PP)
sense.examples: The stock market dove over the trading day. Her performance on tests dove when she started high school.

sense.name: Plunge into a location (usu. water)
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[concrete] DIVE (PP{P NP[location]}) NOTE: If a location is not mentioned, movement into a location should still be implied.
sense.examples: The road dove off the mountain. The teens dove from the cliff to the water below. I lost heart, turned round and dove into the subway. Bakke again dove into the end zone for a touchdown early into the third quarter. He dove for the ball.

sense.name: swim underwater
sense.commentary: NOTE: This sense covers scuba diving. Also, it applies to what's occuring while the agent is already in the water. It doesn't apply to actions that get the agent from a point TO the water.
sense.examples: The children dove to look for shells. Fishermen dive for conch each day along the reef. After completing the course, you may continue to dive with an instructor for half-price. We dove with rented equipment.

sense.name: DIVE IN/INTO: enthusiastically begin an activity
sense.commentary: Is: DIVE IN/INTO NOTE: The activity may be implied, such as eating in ex.2
sense.examples: I dove into the adstoo project with as much enthusiasm as I could muster. The kids dove into the pizza.
